result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert Thieben was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Def is eligible for CIP (as soon as the defendant demonstrates the ability to benefit from it) and is eligible for SAP.

superMiscConds.notes: May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.  No firearms or body armor.    Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or prescription drugs or illegal drugs except as prescried by a physician and approved in advance by agent and then only according to physician's orders.    May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.
No DNA sample or surcharge.  Fine remitted.  Participate in evaluations, follow up and aftercare.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
